instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT: What is PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT? Power rail for RAM. .
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.3V3_S0: What is 3V3_S0? Abbreviation for PP3V3_S0, a 3.3v power rail present when the machine is in an S0 working state.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT</SIGNAL> Shorted to ground
threads.message:
Hi i have this board that sometimes will work at first but as soon as you turn it off it would not power on again, but i think as long as it was on it would stay on.
Anyway i had it sitting around for a while and started looking into it, i have found it in S0 state but missing <SIGNAL>PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT</SIGNAL> would this be bad <CHIP>U7400</CHIP>?
No signs of liquid damage on the board

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT</SIGNAL> Shorted to ground
threads.message: That voltage requires <SIGNAL>MEMVTT_PWR_EN</SIGNAL>; do you get it?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT</SIGNAL> Shorted to ground
threads.message: How do you know it?s shorted to ground what is resistance to ground on that line?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT</SIGNAL> Shorted to ground
threads.message: Really short to ground, board will never boot...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT</SIGNAL> Shorted to ground
threads.message: Sorry yeah it?s not shorted to ground . Just lower resistance then it should be. I will check voltage tomorrow and report back thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT</SIGNAL> Shorted to ground
threads.message: 2informaticos you are correct that voltage is missing, Seems somehow i overlooked that <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> is missing, Found it to be actually be shorted to ground, 1 ohm resistance to ground. Is it safe to inject voltage starting at 1v?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT</SIGNAL> Shorted to ground
threads.message:
First remove <CHIP>U8030</CHIP>.
If short still there, than you can inject voltage at <SIGNAL>3V3_S0</SIGNAL>.
Don't go over 3.7V!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT</SIGNAL> Shorted to ground
threads.message: Thanks you are correct <CHIP>U8030</CHIP> was shorted, Can this chip be purcahsed pre balled?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT</SIGNAL> Shorted to ground
threads.message: Never mind i found it on Rossman Store. Will order it and report back once replaced cheers mate

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT</SIGNAL> Shorted to ground
threads.message: I received the IC today and replaced <CHIP>U8030</CHIP> and board is now working turning on every time thanks for you help mate.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT</SIGNAL> Shorted to ground
threads.message:
Well i just put the board into a machine and seems it has another issue now, fan spins high all the time have cahnged I/o board and cable and track pad with known working still same issue.
HWMonitor reports Heat pipe 2 and Heat pipe outgoing air 128c I have no idea what to look at as im still new to this.

Still seems to work fine though not laggy at all just fan running full spped.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT</SIGNAL> Shorted to ground
threads.message: Check if works good disconnecting camera cable.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT</SIGNAL> Shorted to ground
threads.message: Still same, i dont recall it having this issue before when it would intermittently turn on maybe i messed something up.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT</SIGNAL> Shorted to ground
threads.message: Any other sensors failing on HWMonitor?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT</SIGNAL> Shorted to ground
threads.message: Just Heat pipe 2 and Heat pipe outgoing air, where would I find this area on the board ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT</SIGNAL> Shorted to ground
threads.message:
Should be on LIO board.
Inspect LIO connector on MLB under microscope; especially pins 11 & 13.
Check <RESISTOR>R5370</RESISTOR>/71 and post diode mode to ground on <SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_2_S3_SCL</SIGNAL>/SDA.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT</SIGNAL> Shorted to ground
threads.message:
Think i found the issue, Pin 9 J9500 is missing like its been pulled out probably i was a bit rough with it.
It is <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> (Although the original short to ground was on that line?)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT</SIGNAL> Shorted to ground
threads.message: I wonder if i can run a wire to the I/O board? i wouldnt know where to run it though as there is no schematic

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT</SIGNAL> Shorted to ground
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_2_S3_SCL</SIGNAL>/SDA is 0.701 in diode mode
<RESISTOR>R5370</RESISTOR>/71 are reading correct

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT</SIGNAL> Shorted to ground
threads.message: Well its finally all working now, i ran a wire to the LIO cable its a bit dodgy but hey its working. Thanks for the help much appreciated.
